history: Chun-gee means literally the Heaven, the Earth. In the Orient, it is interpreted as the creation of the world, or the beginning of human history. Therefore, it is the initial pattern played by the beginner. This pattern consists of two similar parts; one representing Heaven, and the other representing Earth.

start.description: Start in an attention stance on the intersection of the A.B. and C.D. lines, facing D.. Move the left foot to B to form a parallel ready stance toward D..

movements.description: Pivoting on the ball of the right foot and turning counter-clockwise, move the left foot to B to form a left walking stance toward B while executing a half-facing low block to B with the left outer forearm.
Move the right foot forward to B to form a right walking stance toward B while executing a full-facing middle front punch to B with the right fore-fist.

Pivoting on the ball of the left foot and turning clockwise, move the right foot to A to form a right walking stance toward A while executing a half-facing low block to A with the right outer forearm.
Move the left foot toward A to form a left walking stance toward A while executing a full-facing middle front punch to A with the left fore-fist.

Pivoting on the ball of the right foot and turning counter-clockwise, move the left foot to D to form a left walking stance toward D while executing a half-facing low block to D with the left outer forearm.
Move the right foot forward to D to form a right walking stance toward D while executing a full-facing middle front punch to D with the right fore-fist.

Pivoting on the ball of the left foot and turning clockwise, move the right foot to C to form a right walking stance toward C while executing a half-facing low block to C with the right outer forearm.
Move the left foot forward to C to form a left walking stance toward C while executing a full-facing middle front punch to C with the left fore-fist.

Pivoting on the ball of the right foot and turning counter-clockwise, move the left foot to A to form a right L-stance toward A while executing a half-facing middle side block to A with the left inner forearm.
Move the right foot forward to A to form a right walking stance toward A while executing a full-facing middle front punch to A with the right fore-fist.

Pivoting on the ball of the left foot and turning clockwise, move the right foot to B to form a left L-stance toward B while executing a full-facing middle side block to B with the right inner forearm.
Move the left foot forward to B to form a left walking stance toward B while executing a full-facing middle front punch to B with the left fore-fist.

Pivoting on the ball of the right foot and turning counter-clockwise, move the left foot to C to form a right L-stance toward C while executing a half-facing middle side block to C with the left inner forearm.
Move the right foot forward to C to form a right walking stance toward C while executing a full-facing middle front punch to C with the right fore-fist.

Pivoting on the ball of the left foot and turning clockwise, move the right foot to D to form a left L-stance toward D while executing a half-facing middle side block to D with the right inner forearm.
Move the left foot forward to D to form a left walking stance toward D while executing a full-facing middle front punch to D with the left fore-fist.
Move the right foot forward to D to form a right walking stance toward D while executing a full-facing middle front punch to D with the right fore-fist.
Move the right foot backward to C to form a left walking stance toward D while executing a full-facing middle front punch to D with the left fore-fist.
Move the left foot backward to C to form a right walking stance toward D while executing a full-facing middle front punch to D with the right fore-fist.

finish.description: Bring the left foot forward onto the A.B. line to return to a parallel ready stance facing D..
